intro: Didymaea microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved didymaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in heads, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in dry conditions.
